intro: Scoparia glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular scoparia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and compound leaves with a hairy texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Scoparia glandulifera is also known for its potential medicinal properties, though its use is limited.
